subject: Home Depot Camera Sharing | Eugene PD
body:
[EXTERNAL ?]

Hi Derek,


We are assisting in a process, in coordination with The Home Depot (THD), to provide agencies with state access to the cameras for both search and hotlist capabilities as a part of their rollout. 


Please be patient with Flock as we anticipate a large volume of requests over the next couple of weeks. The camera share process is manual on the Flock side and once approved we will do our best to complete these in a timely manner. 


If your agency has any questions or concerns, they may reach out to their Flock customer success manager who will direct them to the appropriate contact. 


 

� 

Please review template below, no action is required:




The Home Depot would like to provide your agency with state-wide access to The Home Depot owned Flock safety systems. This technology will assist in preventing or investigating criminal activity in the local community we both serve. The Home Depot technology and your department�s access to such should only be used for bona fide investigations, which are documented within your department and via audit trail within the Flock Safety platform. These investigative tools and technology will not be permitted for personal use, for use on unauthorized devices or by unauthorized users within your department.  I understand if the technology is not used correctly, The Home Depot reserves the right to terminate the department�s access to The Home Depot owned Flock safety systems.




Thank you,

Gaby


-- 

	
Gaby Mahoney
Customer Success Manager



 https://www.instagram.com/flocksafety/ 
 <https://gifo.srv.wisestamp.com/s/rfw4/108062/26/trans.png>  flocksafety.com 

	
 https://kesq.com/news/2024/06/24/flock-license-plate-reading-cameras-have-led-to-more-than-30-arrests-says-palm-springs-police-department?utm_campaign=EmailSignature&utm_source=Success&utm_medium=Wisestamp 

	
 

	
 	 
 <https://tracy.srv.wisestamp.com/px/wsid/RqGQ2llW1Gw.png>
